text: Johannes Peter "Hans" Riegel (10 March 1923 - 15 October 2013)Haribo-Chef Hans Riegel gestorben, focus.de, October 15, 2013 was a German entrepreneur who owned and operated the confectioner Haribo since 1946. Riegel was born on 10 March 1923 in Bonn, Germany. He was the oldest son of the company's founder Hans Riegel Sr., who invented the gummy bear in 1922. He studied at the University of Bonn. Riegel owned the Jakobsburg Hotel and Golf resort near Boppard in the Rhine Valley in Germany. Riegel died on 15 October 2013 from heart failure after a surgical procedure was made to remove a brain tumor in Bonn, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany.
